title: Australia's top 10 richest people 40 and under
text:
Atlassian co-founders Mike Cannon-Brookes and Scott Farquhar head a quintet of technology entrepreneurs at the top of 2019's Financial Review Young Rich List.

The top 10 on the Young Rich List, revealed on Thursday before the full list's publication in Friday's AFR Magazine, has builders of software-as-a-service in the first three places.

Scott Farquhar, left, and Mike Cannon-Brookes have topped the Financial Review Young Rich List again. The New York Times

This reflects the broader dominance of technologists who occupy 36 of the 100 places on the List, which measures the wealth of self-made Australian citizens aged 40 and under.

The founders of Atlassian, which builds collaboration software used by more than 150,000 organisations worldwide, were worth more than $13 billion each when the List was ruled off in the first week of September. Their valuations would be slightly less today, given the subsequent dip in Atlassian shares from more than $US130 to about $US108, although even at that level the stock is priced at a growth-anticipating 20 times sales.

Mr Cannon-Brookes and Mr Farquhar are followed in third place by the engaged couple behind Canva, Melanie Perkins and Cliff Obrecht. The graphic design software-as-a-service platform (with an added marketplace of millions of stock photos) was valued at $4.7 billion by its latest funding round last week.
description: Technology entrepreneurs make up the quintet at the top of 2019's Financial Review Young Rich List.
